str2: Late, evening. From opse; late; feminine afternoon or nightfall.
When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.
The sun, sunlight. From hele; the sun; by implication, light.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To carry, bear, bring; I conduct, lead; perhaps: I make publicly known. A primary verb.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Badly, evilly, wrongly. From kakos; badly.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To be possessed, be under the power of an evil-spirit or demon. Middle voice from daimon; to be exercised by a d?Mon.
